title: Three-Piece Combos
description: Practice hitting 3-4 pads simultaneously for powerful drum combinations.

steps.title: Multi-Pad Hits
steps.description: As you get more comfortable with the drum kit, you'll want to play more pads at once. Real drummers use both hands and both feet simultaneously. Let's practice hitting 3 and 4 pads together for powerful, full-sounding drum hits.

steps.title: Kick + Snare + Hi-Hat
steps.description: The classic full rock hit. This combination on beat 1 is powerful and driving.
steps.hint: Hit KCK, SNR, and CHH all at once.

steps.title: Kick + Snare + Crash
steps.description: The big section starter — kick, snare, and crash together for maximum impact.
steps.hint: Hit KCK, SNR, and CRS all at once.

steps.title: Kick + Clap + Open Hi-Hat
steps.description: A modern pop/electronic combination. The open hi-hat adds energy.
steps.hint: Hit KCK, OHH, and CLP all at once.

steps.title: Snare + Tom + Crash
steps.description: A fill-ending combo. Snare and tom lead into the crash.
steps.hint: Hit SNR, TOM, and CRS all at once.

steps.title: Kick + Snare + Crash + Hi-Hat
steps.description: The ultimate 4-way hit — used at the biggest moments. This requires coordination!
steps.hint: Hit KCK, SNR, CHH, and CRS all at the same time.

steps.title: Combo Quiz
steps.description: Which combination creates the biggest impact at the start of a chorus?
